title: Hacker Group "Valhalla" (Department of Justice, United States Marshals Service, Office of the Federal Detention Trustee)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning or investigating the hacker group Valhalla, also known as Valhal.la operating the Website: (https://valhal.la).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan Grey

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Applications for Transportation, June 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show from June 1, 2024 to June 30, 2024:

1. The number of Application for Transportation Service requests, aka "White Forms", submitted;
2. The number of students who have accepted transportation reimbursement stipends;
3. Special Education Students Missing Active Transportation Request - anonymized aggregated students including type of transportation.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Welcome to the FOIA Center!
communications.communication:
Thank you for registering with the CPS FOIA Center. Please log in to the FOIA Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Your Login ID is:  170575-63964988@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. (https://cps.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx?) 
 
 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: N015925-073024
communications.communication:
Dear Miriam: 
 
Thank you for your interest in Chicago Public Schools. Your FOIA request has been submitted. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: N015925-073024 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show from June 1, 2024 to June 30, 2024:

1. The number of Application for Transportation Service requests, aka "White Forms", submitted;
2. The number of students who have accepted transportation reimbursement stipends;
3. Special Education Students Missing Active Transportation Request - anonymized aggregated students including type of transportation.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fapplications-for-transportation-june-2024-170575%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sYydL%3AYzKC41bjzCppatfrOtEzsa_2pZ3HpObai15zJCas3tU 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15925 (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlKs76dN9xydIq3Or-2BV4u8F-2F6hOuzlMq9EnRzisHCmANXaS7wqWHRHIjUQe81EUM0QlAxQSXWIlNjMCGK-2BeoTZug-3DPN2g_296NUW8wGpXdu6bOhot6cSokC8B1Oz9M8BxHlHemicRk7PNHN0XnQ3b1kfFpO2ZDo9M3XUxJkcIJm1vF22n1LU2DoENinXvEwN-2B8d2jEv-2BI8tlfTi2B-2Fw2992sc68qiYQWBman3ZQGuTZ9ESPUjYPYp-2FTZEUbpSsBxr7x0iNcCnlp2gjFcy6f2ABE-2BimfM88e1IzgWAqdlPM41IH76m5uFLNCEfak3Fvh8nxS0Y-2BYe938ZkxwTAqvBgBPHgztpr4e0iwZES9J-2Fk3PGsSwxLzidbAlzgSbtc6sb1ztw8Iqyn85B-2FFeKfdKRPlBtAUol8p8Ku9KCQkNw1D-2BUGANX0HiEchveEwjSxOVDWk6Ngb2q-2Fltsdd90-2BC-2Ftz-2BXI8vlODr)

title: Orleans Parish Prison Emergency Evacuation Plan (Orleans Parish Sheriff's Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the Orleans Parish Prison's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control of Orleans Parish, including, but not limited to, the Orleans Parish Sheriff's Department and the New Orleans Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

Any and all communications between Myrna Melgar and the following persons:

Mayor London Breed

Joel Engardio

Zach Rosen

Robin Pam

Todd David 

Eddie Kim

Myrna Melgar

title: Harris County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan (Harris County Sheriff)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the Harris County Jail's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control of Harris County, including, but not limited to, the Harris County Sheriff's Office and the Houston Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: "Dodging" PDRs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a Microsoft Teams conversation between Parks employee Samantha Burton and Benjamin Burtzos released in PKS_C160969_05_00006, the employees had the following exchange:

Burton, Samantha 11/17/2023 4:58 PM
I'm too worn down by LP & BL*G

Burtzos, Benjamin 11/17/2023 4:59 PM
Way to dodge that PDR

Burton, Samantha 11/17/2023 4:59 PM
im learning

Please provide all Teams messages in which Burton and Burtzos used asterisks or other punctuation to "dodge" PDRs since September 1, 2023. For all responsive Teams messages, please include any messages in the same chat sent within 30 minutes for context, as well as attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Parks & Recreation :: C191475-073024
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on July 30, 2024 and is appended below. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlIkMrj2cBe016r1is2tP0cnqKj04Rtz3gcHaKnIYvsGIcyHJj-2BtpqX9p2uRmKlqSAyxkBsAm5ymb3RyhZd0c-2Fy8-3DKatM_QOSh58DlMZQ0nl1fE0O9e76rnt2fOBV3456uBAiuIiuj7SWq5mi8v1TDNOm1llI6E09FMGjnfvq7FI6M8S2ClKQqWgE2BBx55Vb24QGchiB7CbWjaOu4mnBPqnlgRdWOIak0yWgmpvL07Dk-2BFqwXHjUbJmu8d31r0V1x-2FeCAHvxYw3BhQonvgAqN7jkcBXNzhudnFHVEjVN2hnOmw-2BDP-2BBZbfWL-2FRDRG9neZSDf2eGysZH-2F3M1V6esxipOtX-2Be2WyNaZUEMQquAX07biXkz5sD7M4QZcyHUMP-2FFehl-2FroQhoga11Yyx5PKzR0UQFoxLSo44nuOtSx66jXlWzc25HMFqMbXUSnrL-2Fo90YQN6iiHR4Ms8yrcIpni6rezxJdRtCQyPC7RkJyznZFI-2Bw-2BatcXA-3D-3D) 
 
The reference number for this request is C191475-073024. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 170523-69356933@requests.muckrock.com (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlIkMrj2cBe016r1is2tP0cnqKj04Rtz3gcHaKnIYvsGIcyHJj-2BtpqX9p2uRmKlqSAyxkBsAm5ymb3RyhZd0c-2Fy8-3DTKI7_QOSh58DlMZQ0nl1fE0O9e76rnt2fOBV3456uBAiuIiuj7SWq5mi8v1TDNOm1llI6E09FMGjnfvq7FI6M8S2ClKQqWgE2BBx55Vb24QGchiB7CbWjaOu4mnBPqnlgRdWOIak0yWgmpvL07Dk-2BFqwXHjUbJmu8d31r0V1x-2FeCAHvxYw3BhQonvgAqN7jkcBXNzhudnFHVEjVN2hnOmw-2BDP-2BBZbfWL-2FRDRG9neZSDf2eGysZH-2F3M1V6esxipOtX-2Be2WYYv2lTa5f3B36YXqna9lpSmfhN57RC0MNVpA6hg1ZjUv6NjRIrN5eYbKDBsKuWN8rfs2Pja6LE-2B5FhnFWP-2BBdhdTvqORN6syap-2BJ9GAIQXbjCq7-2BD4nYjWGjyLW2Mi6lp7ASlGtS4nFJyWTzVPIhtQ-3D-3D) 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlIkMrj2cBe016r1is2tP0cnqKj04Rtz3gcHaKnIYvsGIcyHJj-2BtpqX9p2uRmKlqSAyxkBsAm5ymb3RyhZd0c-2Fy8-3D_a3__QOSh58DlMZQ0nl1fE0O9e76rnt2fOBV3456uBAiuIiuj7SWq5mi8v1TDNOm1llI6E09FMGjnfvq7FI6M8S2ClKQqWgE2BBx55Vb24QGchiB7CbWjaOu4mnBPqnlgRdWOIak0yWgmpvL07Dk-2BFqwXHjUbJmu8d31r0V1x-2FeCAHvxYw3BhQonvgAqN7jkcBXNzhudnFHVEjVN2hnOmw-2BDP-2BBZbfWL-2FRDRG9neZSDf2eGysZH-2F3M1V6esxipOtX-2Be2Wc6BpVl7RV8A6d1XZU0bDSXEwCYaXfS1i4wuVtZREIf68i3YNJf7SgHeOmjzF3ptSgqhpTyPKWqD3FA-2BF-2FrSnsS9kEbMGG7kquTJdYdXCfYLRXtFp0zydqDWTYE4s-2FKINNzCj-2BRubaSJ73aWyOFBktA-3D-3D) 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password'

(https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlIkMrj2cBe016r1is2tP0cnqKj04Rtz3gcHaKnIYvsGIcyHJj-2BtpqX9p2uRmKlqSAyxkBsAm5ymb3RyhZd0c-2Fy8-3D1pGO_QOSh58DlMZQ0nl1fE0O9e76rnt2fOBV3456uBAiuIiuj7SWq5mi8v1TDNOm1llI6E09FMGjnfvq7FI6M8S2ClKQqWgE2BBx55Vb24QGchiB7CbWjaOu4mnBPqnlgRdWOIak0yWgmpvL07Dk-2BFqwXHjUbJmu8d31r0V1x-2FeCAHvxYw3BhQonvgAqN7jkcBXNzhudnFHVEjVN2hnOmw-2BDP-2BBZbfWL-2FRDRG9neZSDf2eGysZH-2F3M1V6esxipOtX-2Be2WovApDpLlc2xTMS3HmRg6KSrvfxVUuKvU4bMSPdsYjhOfbdW2QzpK13GaMu-2BnxTc9VSSNNa7fAip0gyq29AX79FeU0PevzZSa-2FQ7IuT2zMLFMy6u7gyaCSvagKOSyccFoObHGI0Y0mDlEZ7R5sxcShw-3D-3D) 
 
Request C191475-073024:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a Microsoft Teams conversation between Parks employee Samantha Burton and Benjamin Burtzos released in PKS_C160969_05_00006, the employees had the following exchange:

Burton, Samantha 11/17/2023 4:58 PM
I'm too worn down by LP & BL*G

Burtzos, Benjamin 11/17/2023 4:59 PM
Way to dodge that PDR

Burton, Samantha 11/17/2023 4:59 PM
im learning

Please provide all Teams messages in which Burton and Burtzos used asterisks or other punctuation to "dodge" PDRs since September 1, 2023. For all responsive Teams messages, please include any messages in the same chat sent within 30 minutes for context, as well as attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-parks-and-recreations-11682%252Fdodging-pdrs-170523%252F%253Femail%253DFASPDR%252540seattle.gov&url_auth_token=AAA47-w3DtOmZIYfoCfoKV8-o8A%3A1sYm8f%3AoHt18_8lfccRlgRRECM4OymWILwAw_wVE8X7F3fjRao"

title: Public information Act Request: Persistent Surveillance Systems invoices (Thousand Oaks Police Department )

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Public information Act Request: Persistent Surveillance Systems invoices (Thousand Oaks Police Department )
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records responsive to the below requests dated from July 1, 2016, through July 29, 2024.
- The full documentation of all contracts or non-disclosure agreements (enacted OR IN EFFECT between the above dates) with the companies "Persistent Surveillance Systems" or "Vigilant Solutions"
- Copies of all invoices to or from these companies, and documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds to either company
- The full documentation of all contracts (enacted OR IN EFFECT between the above dates) with any company other than the two cited above, in which said company provides your department with equipment or services (including software) for 1. license plate scanning or reading or automatic photographing; 2. aerial surveillance, excluding monitoring roadways for speed infractions.
- Copies of all invoices to or from any company that fits the description in the prior paragraph, and documents sufficient to show any disbursement of public funds to any company that fits this description
- All emails between police department email accounts and users on the domains "pss-1.com" or "vigilantsolutions.com". (One example would be adonisgaynor@vigilantsolutions.com. Users on the domain would be in the form of XXXXXXXXX@vigilantsolutions.com)
- All paper-based communications between your department and Persistent Surveillance Systems, and between your department and Vigilant Solutions. In asking for all paper and electronic correspondence, this request necessarily includes marketing materials and descriptions of product capabilities for any device, software, or access/capability this department has purchased. 
- All warrants regarding the digital communications of Adonis Gaynor e.g. cellphone communications providers, internet providers, email server providers etc. (see California electronic communications privacy Act). 
- Documents sufficient to show all rules or regulations governing the use of products (hardware or software) that do 1. license plate scanning or reading or automatic photographing; 2. aerial surveillance, excluding monitoring roadways for speed infractions.
- The text of all agreements (whether formal, email, memo, or otherwise) between your department and any other public body or department that allows your department to use or access the capabilities of 1. license plate scanning or reading or automatic photographing; 2. aerial surveillance, excluding monitoring roadways for speed infractions.
- Documents sufficient to show the month and year your department first entered a program of scanning license plates or accessing a database of scanned plates, if it indeed has such a program (and end date of said program if it has ended).
- Documents sufficient to show the total number of license plates scanned in your department's jurisdiction (whether the jurisdiction in this case is precisely or roughly represented) since the department began its plate-scanning program or first purchased access to such a program
- Documents sufficient to show the month and year your department first entered a program of persistent aerial surveillance, if it indeed has such a program (and end date of said program if it has ended).
- Documents sufficient to show the number of plane-hours of aerial surveillance (excluding monitoring roadways for speed infractions) purchased by your department within the dates at the top of this request. For example, one plane flying for four hours is four plane-hours. Two planes flying for four hours is eight plane-hours.
- Documents sufficient to show any attempt made by a representative of your department to inform the public about automatic license plate readers or persistent aerial surveillance. This could include but is not limited to records of town hall meetings, quotes from police spokespeople in local media, or text from the department's website.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. adonis gaynor

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Entergy Texts with Hugh McDonald
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All text messages between Secretary Hugh McDonald and Danny Games.

This request should search professional accounts and any personal accounts used for professional purposes.

Please include any administrative assistant(s) and chiefs of staff that may report to the named individual.

The timeframe of this public records request is between January 1, 2024 through July 28, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Daniel Tait.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Military Service Record (Amedd Record Processing Center)
Mail

To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
A releasable copy of the Official Military Personnel File of PVT, Julius O. Pearse, date of birth Jul 6, 1933, which should include: Name, Service Number, Dates of Service, Branch of Service, Final Duty Status, Final Rank, Assignments and Geographical locations, Military Education Level, Awards and Decorations, Photograph, Transcripts of Courts-Martial Trial, and place of entrance and separation
I would also like a releasable copy of PVT Julius O. Pearse's Official Personnel Folder which should include: past and present positions, past and present titles, past and present salaries, past and present grades, past and present job locations
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julius Otto Pearse

title: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails of Sharon Walsh (sharon.walsh@uky.edu) and Michelle Lofwall (michelle.lofwall@uky.edu) from January 2019 until today, July 29th, 2024. Please include all attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wes Anderson

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Wozniak

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Wozniak

Hello,
All Right-To-Know requests must be submitted through the Township's online
Records Request Center. To access the Records Request Center, see link
below.

https://www.twpusc.org/departments/police/police_forms.php

Respectfully,

Upper St. Clair Police Department

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Steve Collins Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every Seattle Fire Department  investigative and/or disciplinary file for former SFD employee Steve Collins, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Fire - General :: C191221-072824
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on July 28, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C191221-072824. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 170405-81685893@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C191221-072824:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every Seattle Fire Department investigative and/or disciplinary file for former SFD employee Steve Collins, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-fire-department-18127%252Fsteve-collins-disciplinary-records-170405%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AABfPylg8I-eETibmjYs8kdTZw8%3A1sYFfV%3AALUbvLofq2F4hdVSO71CQlMTjn43FM2MoTVL48T7DAs"
